name: How much do you know about General Knowledge 4? | Quiz

questions.text: Of the twelve signs of the Zodiac which one is known as 'The Archer'?
questions.explanation:
Sagittarius.

	Aquarius (the Watercarrier), Capricorn (the Goat) and Virgo (the Virgin)

questions.text: Which author created Sherlock Holmes?
Goulash is the national dish of which country?
Name the author of 'Ivanhoe'.
Who had a cat called Dinah?
What is the capital of Pakistan?
Uriah Heep appears in which Dicken's novel?
Which ship was not associated with Captain James Cook?
questions.explanation:
Terra Nova.

	The 'Terra Nova' was the ship of Robert Falcon Scott as was a ship also called the 'Discovery'.

questions.text: Which sea was known as 'Mare Nostrum' (our sea) to the Romans?
Name the 1959 novel by William Burroughs.
God gave Moses the 'Ten Commandments' on Mount ___.
Dodge City is located in which American State?
Stockholm, the capital of Sweden, is built on how many small islands which are connected by about 50 bridges?
What type of creature has a variety called Medusa?
questions.explanation:
Jellyfish.

	The Medusa is umbrella-shaped and it derives its name from the snake-haired Gorgon on account of its long tentacles.

questions.text: What was the nationality of Dennis Gabor who invented holograms in 1948 and received the Nobel Prize in physics in 1971?
Name the 1925 play by Noel Coward.
questions.explanation:
Hay Fever.

	'Sea Fever' was written by British poet and novelist, John Masefield.

questions.text: What fruit is used to make guacamole?
What does a tegestologist collect?
questions.explanation:
Beer mats.

	An oologist collects bird's eggs, a scripophilist collects certificates and a rabdophilist collects walking sticks.

questions.text: What does an ocularist make?
The Stanley Cup, introduced in 1893, was named after Lord Stanley, then Governor General of Canada. In which sport is this the most prestigious trophy?
Which explorer discovered the island of Jamaica?
Through which country does the River Mania flow?
When the Athenian army defeated the invading Persians, who ran 26 miles to Athens to announce the victory?
questions.explanation:
Pheidippides.

	And then he dropped down dead.

questions.text: What does a fusilatelist collect?
questions.explanation:
Telephone cards.

	An arcturologist collects teddy bears and a collectaneist collects quotations. Hope you didn't fall for the red herring, model aircraft!

questions.text: Name a play, a small village and a brand of cigar?
questions.explanation:
Hamlet.

	Hope you enjoyed the challenge.
